author: COMSOL
description: A Gaussian electromagnetic wave is incident on a dense array of very thin rods. The distance between the rods and, thus, also the rod diameter is much smaller than the wavelength. Under these circumstances, the rod array does not function as a diffraction grating. Instead, the rod array behaves as if it is a continuous metal sheet for light polarized along the rods, whereas for light polarized perpendicular to the rods, the array is almost transparent for the electromagnetic wave.
label: nanorods.mph
name: root
